The Procurement Director will report directly to the Senior Procurement Director in Hong Kong.  This position will be responsible for leading a supply chain team of professionals in Hong Kong, responsible for the strategic sourcing development and operational management of all product procurement for the company (watches components commodities). 

The main goals are to optimize the total cost of ownership for the company, protect IP, maximize the service from vendors in order to meet key stakeholders business expectations, maintain the required quality and delivery levels and ensure compliance with international norms/ regulations and licensor’s requirements.

Responsibilities:


Work with key stakeholders to strategically evolve the network of suppliers and consolidate where appropriate to leverage efficiencies, mitigate risk and simplify "run the business" activities and drive cost savings. 
Continue the robust gross margin enhancement program through the roll out of continuous improvement initiatives at supply partners, motivating key internal Supply Chain and QA stakeholders and supplementing with external resources to drive meaningful cost reduction projects that have a favorable ROI.
Strategically lead the cost savings program, providing the commercial team with options and recommendations to drive down unit cost and improve gross margin.
Relentlessly pursue excellence in service levels. He/She will motivate the Supply Planning, Sourcing and Quality teams to collaborate on optimizing batch sizes, run frequency, risk identification and mitigation, lead time reduction and supply chain simplification to achieve service level targets while decreasing overall investment in working capital.
Foster a team environment, delegated decision making, creative thinking, and excellence in internal customer service. Be accessible and visible, demonstrating energy, passion and enthusiasm.
Actively participate concurrently in the New Product Innovation program and staged gate deliverables, including idea generation, driving awareness of supply-side capabilities and relevant new product developments, and creating a culture across Operations that embraces the importance of every employee in the New Product Development process to effectively launch new SKUs to drive organic company growth.
Building on the business intelligence and current Oracle/Excel reports, institute a data-driven Supplier Performance Scorecard program to measure firm's key desirable attributes: Quality, Service, Cost containment and Supply Continuity. 
Foster and develop long-term supplier relationships to create a cooperative and professional framework, while protecting Timex IP, whereby firm's supply partners desire to share in Timex’s growth and success, and work tirelessly on continuous improvement to reduce cost and waste.
Stay informed of current industry-wide regulatory requirements and emerging trends, and ensure that suppliers to Timex conform to these requirements; monitor gap closure plans to mitigate shortfalls as needed. 
Develop and mentor employees and ensure their readiness for company and personal career growth; ensure programs are developed for enhanced use of Oracle and other supply chain tools.  Build an organization so that the balance between tactical and strategic is close to 50/50. 
Requirement:

Bachelor Degree in Mechanical/Electronic/industrial Engineering or related field is minimum with Master Degree is preferred (Mechanical, Electronic Engineering or MBA)
10+ years of progression in leadership responsibilities in sourcing and commodity purchasing.  Experience in watch industry and China experience is preferred.  
Experience in managing a high volume, high mix portfolio in similar industries (Fast consumer good) and experience in dealing with electronics, mechanical, plating, electro-mechanical technologies.

Fluent verbal, presentation and written skills in English and Chinese.  Fluent in Mandarin is preferred.
